item.name: Middle East, North Africa, and Central Asia Subcommittee

item.title: A resolution recognizing the importance of the United States-Israel economic relationship and encouraging new areas of cooperation.

latestAction.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: CR S2500)

item.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Subcommittee on Middle East and North Africa Discharged.

item.name: Middle East, North Africa, and Central Asia Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Middle East and North Africa.
Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
Affirms that the U.S.-Israel economic partnership has benefitted both countries and is a foundational component of the strong alliance.

Recognizes that science and technology innovation present new frontiers for U.S.-Israel economic cooperation, particularly in light of widespread drought, cybersecurity attacks, and other major challenges impacting the United States.

Encourages the Administration to expand forums of economic dialogue with Israel.

Supports the exploration of new agreements with Israel, including in the fields of energy, water, agriculture, medicine, neurotechnology and cybersecurity.

bill.title: Recognizing the importance of the United States-Israel economic relationship and encouraging new areas of cooperation.

item.title: Recognizing the importance of the United States-Israel economic relationship and encouraging new areas of cooperation.
Recognizing the importance of the United States-Israel economic relationship and encouraging new areas of cooperation.

latestAction.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
